lessons.title: Combustion Chamber
lessons.text: Fuel burns in combustion chambers inside an engine...
lessons.analogy: Think of the combustion chamber like the firebox in a wood stove.

quiz.question: What creates the 'floor' of the combustion chamber?
quiz.feedback: Correct! The piston creates the moving floor of the chamber.

lessons.title: The Engine Block
lessons.text: An engine block is the most basic part of an engine...
lessons.analogy: The block is like the foundation of a house—solid and it doesn’t move.

quiz.question: Does the engine block itself have moving parts?
quiz.feedback: Right. The block is the solid base that everything bolts onto.

lessons.title: Crankcase
lessons.text: The crankcase is the lower part of the engine where the crankshaft runs...
lessons.analogy: Like the bottom half of a toolbox that holds the moving parts and oil.

lessons.title: Main Bearings
lessons.text: Main bearings support the crankshaft so it can spin smoothly...
lessons.analogy: Like smooth supports that let a heavy log roll without grinding.

lessons.title: The Piston
lessons.text: A piston resembles an empty soup can turned upside down...
lessons.analogy: Like a soup can getting pushed down by an explosion above it.

quiz.question: What shape is a piston when it is cold?
quiz.feedback: Yes — slightly oval when cold, so it becomes round when hot.

lessons.title: Rings
lessons.text: Rings fit around the piston and help seal the cylinder...
lessons.analogy: Like the seal on a syringe that keeps pressure from leaking past.

lessons.title: Camshaft
lessons.text: The camshaft controls when valves open and close...
lessons.analogy: Like a timed “bump wheel” that pushes the valves at the right moment.

lessons.title: Timing Systems
lessons.text: Timing systems keep the camshaft and crankshaft working together...
lessons.analogy: Like two gears that must stay lined up or everything runs wrong.

lessons.title: Head
lessons.text: The engine head bolts to the top of the block and forms part of the combustion chamber...
lessons.analogy: Like the lid on a pressure pot—strong, sealed, and shaped inside.

lessons.title: Valves
lessons.text: Valves are doors to the combustion chambers...
lessons.analogy: Like gates that open to let air/fuel in and exhaust out.

quiz.question: What do valves do?
options: Act as doors for fuel and exhaust
quiz.feedback: Correct — valves are timed doors for intake and exhaust.

lessons.title: Valve Assembly
lessons.text: The valve assembly includes parts that move the valves and return them closed...
lessons.analogy: Like a door hinge plus a spring that snaps it shut.

lessons.title: Engine Test
lessons.text: Review: answer the questions on this page in the book, one at a time.
lessons.analogy: This is practice day—slow and steady.
